newsitem.title: UK: Eurobond market awaits Toyota, Argentina in dlrs.
newsitem.headline: Eurobond market awaits Toyota, Argentina in dlrs.

text.p: Dollar Eurobond issuance was set to continue unabated this week, with a handful of large dollar deals already in the pipeline on Monday.
On Tuesday, Toyota Motor Corp is due to launch a $1.0 billion five-year Euro-Asian bond via Credit Suisse First Boston and Merrill Lynch.
Spread talk for the triple-A rated deal was around 10 basis points over U.S. Treasury notes. The bonds will be listed in London, Hong Kong and Singapore.
Also in the coming days, Argentina is due to issue a $750 million seven-year global bond, via CSFB and SBC Warburg. Bankers said spread talk ranged between 175 and 200 b.p. over U.S. Treasuries.
Argentina is rated B1 by Moody's and BB by Standard & Poor's.
Issuance of jumbo dollar bonds has surged in recent months on the back of a strong dollar and uncertainty about the single currency in Europe.
Last week, Canada issued a $1.0 billion five-year bond at eight b.p. over Treasuries, which was quoted at 8/7.5 over on Monday.
Also, Philip Morris launched a $1.0 billion eight-year bond at 78 b.p. over, where it was still trading. Philip Morris is rated A2 by Moody's and A by S&P.
